segments.text: I can’t believe how much water is just gushing out of that sink, and the woman is acting like it’s not even happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is soaked, and she doesn’t even seem to care, which is just bizarre.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel bad for the floor—it’s going to be ruined by the time she notices the water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are sneaking cookies, and she’s completely clueless about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll slip and fall before she even notices the water everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is really going for it, stretching as far as he can to get those cookies, and it’s kind of impressive.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can almost hear the water splashing everywhere, and it’s just getting worse by the second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is such a strange mix of calm and chaos in the same room, and it’s fascinating to watch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope no one gets hurt before she finally turns around and sees what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole kitchen is going to be a mess soon if this keeps up, and it’s kind of sad to think about.
segments.speaker: PAR
